It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grasses. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Pothuava drakeana is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
